channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8316563] test tools/jpackage/linux/LinuxResourceTest.java fails on CentOS Linux release 8.5.2111 and Fedora 27
item.description:
on some RHEL Linux 8.X and Fedora 27 machines , we run into errors in test tools/jpackage/linux/LinuxResourceTest.java.

After 8314121, tools/jpackage/linux/LinuxResourceTest.java repeats.

error output :

java.lang.AssertionError: Expected [1]. Actual [2]: Check the package has 1 top installation directories
at jdk.jpackage.test.TKit.error(TKit.java:273)
at jdk.jpackage.test.TKit.assertEquals(TKit.java:576)
at jdk.jpackage.test.PackageTest$Handler.verifyRootCountInUnpackedPackage(PackageTest.java:705)

at jdk.jpackage.test.TKit.lambda$ignoreExceptions$5(TKit.java:141)
at jdk.jpackage.test.TKit.lambda$runTests$3(TKit.java:126)
at java.base/java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1708)
at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$Head.forEach(ReferencePipeline.java:762)
at jdk.jpackage.test.TKit.lambda$runTests$4(TKit.java:123)

item.summary: test tools/jpackage/linux/LinuxResourceTest.java fails on CentOS Linux release 8.5.2111 and Fedora 27

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
[jdk21u-fix-request] Approval Request from sendaoYan
"This PR only change the testcase, the testcase change has been verified. Please review this PR."

[jdk17u-fix-request] Approval Request from sendaoYan
"This PR only change the testcase, the testcase change has been verified. Please review this PR."

Changeset: 52814994
Author: sunyaqi <sunyaqi@loongson.cn>
Committer: Alexey Semenyuk <asemenyuk@openjdk.org>
Date: 2023-10-20 16:27:58 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/52814994efc4831fdbc1f796ed1db6ae88cb616c

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/15832
Date: 2023-09-20 03:32:55 +0000

The following modified tests pass：

```
diff --git a/src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/LinuxRpmBundler.java b/src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/LinuxRpmBundler.java
index f65210553de..c362dd48a16 100644
--- a/src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/LinuxRpmBundler.java
+++ b/src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/LinuxRpmBundler.java
@@ -310,7 +310,8 @@ private Path buildRPM(Map<String, ? super Object> params,
                 // do not use other system directories to build as current user
                 "--define", String.format("%%_topdir %s",
                         TEMP_ROOT.fetchFrom(params).toAbsolutePath()),
- "--define", String.format("%%_rpmfilename %s", rpmFile.getFileName())
+ "--define", String.format("%%_rpmfilename %s", rpmFile.getFileName()),
+ "--define", "_build_id_links none"
         ).executeExpectSuccess();
 
         Log.verbose(MessageFormat.format(
```

or

```
git diff src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/LinuxRpmBundler.java
diff --git a/src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/LinuxRpmBundler.java b/src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/LinuxRpmBundler.java
index f65210553de..c362dd48a16 100644
--- a/src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/LinuxRpmBundler.java
+++ b/src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/LinuxRpmBundler.java
@@ -310,7 +310,8 @@ private Path buildRPM(Map<String, ? super Object> params,
                 // do not use other system directories to build as current user
                 "--define", String.format("%%_topdir %s",
                         TEMP_ROOT.fetchFrom(params).toAbsolutePath()),
- "--define", String.format("%%_rpmfilename %s", rpmFile.getFileName())
+ "--define", String.format("%%_rpmfilename %s", rpmFile.getFileName()),
+ "--define", "_build_id_links none"
         ).executeExpectSuccess();
 
         Log.verbose(MessageFormat.format(
```
[~asemenyuk] looks like we are seeing the .build-id folder again in this test failure. Do we need to disable it at some other place (maybe another template.spec) ?

jdk/tools/jpackage/helpers/jdk/jpackage/test/PackageTest.java debug output:

```
expectedRootCount ===== 1
files.count() ===== 2

```

$ ls ./build/linux-x86_64-server-release/test-support/jtreg_test_jdk_tools_jpackage_linux_LinuxResourceTest_java/tools/jpackage/linux/LinuxResourceTest/testHardcodedProperties/unpacked-rpm
opt usr

$ ls ./build/linux-x86_64-server-release/test-support/jtreg_test_jdk_tools_jpackage_linux_LinuxResourceTest_java/tools/jpackage/linux/LinuxResourceTest/testHardcodedProperties/unpacked-rpm/usr/lib/.build-id
6e 84

[~syaqi] , I am not a jpackage expert; but could you maybe add a bit of output to or before the assertEquals call so that we can see what files/directories are present and unexpected?
jdk/tools/jpackage/helpers/jdk/jpackage/test/PackageTest.java

704 try ( var files = Files.list(unpackedDir)) {
705 TKit.assertEquals(expectedRootCount, files.count(),
706 String.format(
707 "Check the package has %d top installation directories",
708 expectedRootCount));
709 } catch (IOException ex) {

[~asemenyuk] have you seen the mentioned issue ?
This problem has always existed, and it can be repeated before https://bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8314121.

The problem was also repeated before JDK-8314121, so it is not regression?
 tools/jpackage/* test cases pass with below, but only tools/jpackage/Linux/LinuxResourceTest.java still repetition.

# on RHEL we got unwanted improved debugging enhancements
%define _build_id_links none


The above test phenomenon is in the system environment:

$ cat /etc/redhat-release
CentOS Linux release 8.5.2111

Does the mentioned error occur on your system with this

# on RHEL we got unwanted improved debugging enhancements
%define _build_id_links none

removed from src/jdk.jpackage/linux/classes/jdk/jpackage/internal/resources/template.spec ?
We test on RHEL 8 and do not see this error in our tests.
[~mbaesken] looks like a regression after JDK-8314121 in 22 and 21.0.2
